actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-62.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 28.
Mr. Franks moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 50.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings, Hazardous Materials and Pipeline Transportation

official_title: Authorizing the 1999 District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run to be run through the Capitol Grounds.

summary.text: Authorizes the 1999 District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run to be run through the Capitol Grounds as part of the journey of the Special Olympics torch to the D.C. Special Olympics summer games at Gallaudet University.

titles.title: Authorizing the 1999 District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run to be run through the Capitol Grounds.
